column1: You may have had hip pinning surgery or a special metal plate or rod with screws, called compression screws or nails, put in place.
It is not normal to have foul smell or drainage that last more than the first 3 to 4 days after surgery.
Change your dressing (bandage) over your incision every day if it is OK with your provider.
Check your incision for any signs of infection at least once a day.
- Ask your provider to check you for osteoporosis (thin, weak bones) after you have healed from your surgery and are able to more tests.
